medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, neck pain radiating to the jaw, and palpitations occurring 15 days after a SARS-CoV-2 positive oropharyngeal swab.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with mild upper respiratory symptoms (rhinorrhea and cough) following a positive SARS-CoV-2 test on February 28th. On March 17th, the patient presented with sudden fever (37.5 Â°C), fatigue, palpitations, and anterior neck pain radiating to the jaw. The neck pain worsened, leading to referral on March 19th.
medical_history.past_medical_history: One month prior to symptom onset, thyroid evaluation ruled out thyroid diseases, with normal function and imaging.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father had been hospitalized for COVID-19 shortly before her symptoms began.
